result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Phillip Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office.

**Per Amended Restitution Order dated 10/10/2016: $16,353.82 restitution ($8,176.91 to G.K. and $8,176.91 to J.J.), plus a 10% surcharge to DA's office of $1,635.38, for a total of $17,989.20, to be paid to Probation. Joint & Several with Tyler Chute (14CF53), John Moon (14CF105) & Jason West (14CF70).  Restitution if not paid within term of prison or Extended Supervision this amount may be reduced to civil judgment on behalf of creditors. Restitution may come out of prison fund.
***An Amended Judgment of Conviction was not generated in 2016 to reflect the Amended Restitution Order dated 10/10/2016, one is being done now to accurately reflect the restitution amounts ordered per the Amended Restitution Order.
Must provide DNA sample and pay $250 surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

No contact with Gary Kahl or his spouse or residence only unless as made by Probation.  
No contact with Tyler Chute, John Moon and Jason West.  
May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
May not hold elected office.
If not a US citizen may face deportations or loss of other rights.

Defendant Shawn P Thompson in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant Shawn P Thompson in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:04 am. Count 1-  10 yrs WSP-5 IC, 5 ES.  DNA sample & $250 surcharge.  $290.60 fine/costs.  COMPAS follow recommendations.  No contact w/ Mr Kahl or his spouse or residence only unless as made by probation.  NC w/ Tyler Chute, John Moon, Jason West.

Count 2-w/h sentence, probation up to 3 yrs, consecutive to count 1.  COMPAS follow recommendations.  No contact w/ Mr Kahl or his spouse or residence only unless as made by probation.  NC w/ Tyler Chute, John Moon, Jason West.

Count 19 & 20 - w/h sentence, probation up to 4 yrs, concurrent to count 2 but consecutive to count 1.  COMPAS follow recommendations.  No contact w/ Mr Kahl or his spouse or residence only unless as made by probation.  NC w/ Tyler Chute, John Moon, Jason West.

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other rights.
Restitution-if not paid w/in term of prison, ES or probation-may be reduced to civil judgment on behalf of creditors after determination has been made have made good faith effort.  Restitution may come out of prison fund.
